unnormalised: So, I've been hearing a lot about adaptive learning lately, especially in the ed-tech space. Is it really all that? Or just the latest shiny toy schools are pushing?
normalised: So, I have been hearing a lot about adaptive learning lately, especially in the e-d-tech space. Is it really all that? Or just the latest shiny toy schools are pushing?

unnormalised: Basically, as I understand it, adaptive learning uses algorithms to personalize education for each student. Like, if Priya from IIT-Delhi is struggling with Vector Calculus but killing it in Linear Algebra, the system will automatically give her more practice problems on Vector Calculus and less on Linear Algebra. Makes sense, right?
normalised: Basically, as I understand it, adaptive learning uses algorithms to personalize education for each student. Like, if Priya from I I T-Delhi is struggling with Vector Calculus but killing it in Linear Algebra, the system will automatically give her more practice problems on Vector Calculus and less on Linear Algebra. Makes sense, right?

unnormalised: My cousin, Rohan, used it in his coaching classes in Kota before his IIT-JEE prep. He said it really helped him focus on his weak areas. Apparently, some platforms even adapt the difficulty level in real time, which sounds kinda cool. Think of it like a personalized tutor that never sleeps!
